intro: Mesembryanthemum bellidifolium, commonly known as the bellidifolium ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or rocky environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its thick, waxy leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the morning and close in the heat of the day. Mesembryanthemum bellidifolium is often used in xeriscaping due to its low water requirements and ornamental value.
